br.uff.midiacom.ana
Class NCLDoc<T extends NCLElement,Eh extends NCLHead,Eb extends NCLBody,Ev extends NCLVariable>

java.lang.Object
  br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.xml.XMLElementPrototype<T>
      br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.ncl.NCLElementPrototype<T>
          br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.ncl.NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>

All Implemented Interfaces:
NCLElement<T>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLDoc<T extends NCLElement,Eh extends NCLHead,Eb extends NCLBody,Ev extends NCLVariable>
extends NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLElement<T>

Class that represents the NCL document root element.
This element defines the attributes:

  • id - id of the document root element. This attribute is optional.
  • title - additional information about the document. This attribute is optional.
  • xmlns - NCL document namespace. It defines the possible elements to be used inside the document. This attribute is required.

This element has as children the elements:
  • head - NCL document head element. This element is optional.
  • body - NCL document body element. This element is optional.

setTitle

public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
              throws XMLException
Sets the root element title. The title defines additional information about the document. This attribute is optional. Set the title to null to erase the title already defined.

Parameters:
title - string with additional information about the document or null to erase the title already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if the string representing the title is empty.

setXmlns

public void setXmlns(NCLNamespace xmlns)
              throws XMLException
Sets the namespace to be used by the document. It defines the possible elements to be used inside the document. This attribute is required and can not be set to null. The possible namespaces to be used are defined in the enumeration NCLNamespace.

Parameters:
xmlns - document namespace from the enumeration NCLNamespace.
Throws:
XMLException - if the value representing the namespace is null.

getXmlns

public NCLNamespace getXmlns()
Returns the namespace to be used by the document or null if the attribute is not defined. It defines the possible elements to be used inside the document. The possible namespaces to be used are defined in the enumeration NCLNamespace.

Returns:
document namespace from the enumeration NCLNamespace or null if the namespace is not defined.
